ai.summary: A 25.1 km hard coastal hike along the Bournemouth coast in the UK, featuring dramatic cliff views, sandy beaches, and varied terrain from cliff-top paths to beach stretches. Route details assume a single-day outing and may pass exposed sections near the sea.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly coastal trails with a mix of cliff-top paths, shingle and sandy beaches, steps, and uneven surfaces. Expect exposed sections with strong winds, sea spray, and occasional muddy sections after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Check tide times before beach sections; stay back from cliff edges and avoid unstable sections. Weather can change rapidly; be prepared for wind and rain. Wear sturdy footwear, carry a map or GPS, and bring adequate water and snacks. Tell someone your planned route and expected return time; carry a charged phone and basic first-aid kit.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to early autumn (roughly March–September) for milder weather and better daylight; be aware that coastal winds can be stronger and weather more unpredictable in autumn and winter.

seo.title: Bournemouth Coast Path – 25.1 km Hard Coastal Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Bournemouth Coast Path: a 25.1 km hard coastal hike along the UK's south coast. Expect dramatic cliffs, beaches, and vigorous coastal terrain.
seo.h1: Bournemouth Coast Path: 25.1 km Hard Coastal Hike
